text: Anyone know of any tutorials or resources on how to create mega menus in HubSpot? Not finding a lot of documentation out there... Is there a better thread to post this question?
I’ve achived it using the advanced menus (more than 1) and creating a module :smile:
I read somewhere you can add html markup to the advanced menu label fields? Is that what you did? Or do you style the advanced menu in the custom module?
I’ve created my own html into a module and used a for loop for each advanced menu :slightly_smiling_face:

There are a number of ways you can create a mega menu on HubSpot.

The best way is probably to use the`menu()` hubl function inside of a custom module.

Use the module to add any unique features your mega menu needs. and use 1 menu from site settings to control the outputted navigation

Here’s a basic example of how you can use the `menu()` function
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/TheWebTech-Basic-Menu-using-Menu-Function?hsLang=en>

This recreates a menu similar to the HubSpot default, as the default is a good starting point. You can then add the features you need on top of that.


Some alternative methods that people used before the `menu()` function was released:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/How-do-you-build-a-mega-menu-in-HubSpot-CMS/td-p/199132>
Hey, anyone ever tried (successfully) looping the results of a multi-select contact property in hubl?
is there a variable that contain the email language in hubl ?

Hi I’m trying to match a variable to a “this or that” value like this:
```{% set var = 'apple' %}
{{ var == ('orange' or 'apple') }}```
But this seems to evaluate to false? Can anyone tell me what’s wrong.
